blocks.value: St. Maria Faustina Kowalska was born in Poland in 1905. She entered the Congregation of the Sisters of Our Lady of Mercy in 1925. Sister Faustina received visions of Jesus, who asked her to spread the message of Divine Mercy and to have an image painted with the inscription "Jesus, I Trust in You."

Jesus revealed to St. Faustina the Chaplet of Divine Mercy and asked that the Feast of Divine Mercy be celebrated on the Sunday after Easter. The message of Divine Mercy emphasizes God's infinite love and mercy for all souls, especially sinners.

St. Faustina died of tuberculosis in 1938 at the age of 33. She was canonized by Pope John Paul II on April 30, 2000, the first saint of the new millennium. The Divine Mercy devotion has spread throughout the world.
